meanings.sent1: She was feazing about her upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: He always starts feazing before a big presentation.
meanings.sent3: The cat was feazing when it heard thunder outside.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds feazed the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent5: The thought of being late made her feazing uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: The siblings enjoyed feazing each other playfully.
meanings.sent2: The bullies were feazing the new student in school.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was feazing the cat's tail.
meanings.sent4: The magician feazed the audience with his disappearing act.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or blunder.
meanings.sent1: She feazed by accidentally deleting the important file.
meanings.sent2: He feazed during the dance performance but recovered gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The chef feazed by adding too much salt to the dish.
meanings.sent4: The quarterback feazed by throwing an interception in the final minutes.
meanings.sent5: The student feazed on the math test by forgetting to carry over the digit.
